text:
Celebrated Hindi author Ved Prakash Sharma, writer of 176 novels, dead at 62 books Updated: Feb 18, 2017 13:22 IST IANS Sharma had also written scripts for about half-a-dozen Hindi movies. 
Celebrated Hindi novelist Ved Prakash Sharma, who has 176 novels to his credit, died late on Friday in Meerut, his family members said on Saturday. 
The 62-year-old was not keeping well for the last few months and had developed some infections which led to his demise. 
Sharma had also written scripts for about half-a-dozen Hindi movies. 
He was a writer of pulp thrillers like Qaidi No 100 and Vardi Wala Gunda and earned him fame. 
He will be cremated in Meerut on Saturday. Writer of the very popular novel- वर्दी वाला गुंडा- Ved Prakash Sharma expired yesterday. Great loss to literature. RIP — ANANT VIJAY (@anantvijay) February 18, 2017 Writer Ved Prakash Sharma no more... RIP @authoramish
